channel.title: Arpeggiator for my Volca Keys
channel.description:
Here's a little demo of an arpeggiator for the Volca Keys. It uses cpwitz/midi/arpeggiator object (thanks @cpwitz ! ) Sorry about the shitty audio, it is coming out of my headphones and recorded with my cellphone. The knobs do, from left to right: -Note length -Direction (R is random and O is order) -Octaves -Octave transposition -Probability (the higher the more notes are played) It uses phi/prob/%prob object (thanks @philoop !)
[https://youtu.be/9VunfMtNnlg](https://youtu.be/9VunfMtNnlg)

item.title: Arpeggiator for my Volca Keys
item.dc:creator: @TTotelka
item.description:
@TTotelka wrote:

Here's a little demo of an arpeggiator for the Volca Keys. It uses cpwitz/midi/arpeggiator object (thanks @cpwitz ! )
Sorry about the shitty audio, it is coming out of my headphones and recorded with my cellphone.
The knobs do, from left to right:
-Note length
-Direction (R is random and O is order)
-Octaves
-Octave transposition
-Probability (the higher the more notes are played) It uses phi/prob/%prob object (thanks @philoop !)
